headline: OPINION: The perfect place for Supercars’ retro round to return
context: SUPERCARS’ regular retro round at Sandown in the mid-to-late 2010s was always a winner with the people that matter most in motorsport – the fans.
And it was a winner too for the teams who, granted, had to pony up and spend extra cash on liveries, re-wrapping cars and creating uniforms.

annotations.paragraph: But it gave buzz, content (for all!) and a way to generate interest that, to be honest, the lead-up to the next round at the moment isn’t doing.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context on the benefits of the retro round format, which is relevant to the discussion of its potential return.

annotations.paragraph: Since 2019’s Sandown 500 the retro round format has disappeared and not been re-introduced.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides factual information about the discontinuation of the retro round format.

annotations.paragraph: However, with long gaps between rounds – a problem not easily nor quickly fixed – the re-introduction of the format is a must to help keep fans connected to the sport in the lead-up to a round with historic significant and heritage-flavour on any given year.
annotations.reason: This paragraph argues for the re-introduction of the retro round format, directly relating to the article's premise.

annotations.paragraph: And, in my mind, that round to become the retro round in the future just happens to be the next one on the calendar.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a personal opinion on which round should be the retro round, relevant to the article's main argument.
This paragraph identifies the specific location proposed for the retro round, directly contributing to the article's main argument.

annotations.paragraph: Next year the Tasmanian round should become the retro round to help ensure this long serving race track isn’t treated by anyone as ‘just another round’.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces the main argument of the opinion piece, suggesting a specific location for the retro round.

annotations.paragraph: Symmons Plains has hosted the most rounds in the history of the Australian Touring Car/Supercars Championship bar Sandown. This year is the 52nd round and 96th, 97th and 98th races at the track just outside Launceston.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant historical context about Symmons Plains, supporting the argument for its selection.

annotations.paragraph: Next year will see the track celebrate its 100th championship race and there’s no better way to do it than celebrate the sport’s history and heritage in a way that no other round outside Sandown or Bathurst really can.
annotations.reason: This paragraph emphasizes the significance of the upcoming milestone at Symmons Plains, reinforcing the argument.

annotations.paragraph: Sandown’s place in the back end of the calendar gives it the penultimate round and an all-important leg in the Supercars Finals. It doesn’t need the retro formula.
annotations.reason: This paragraph argues why Sandown does not need the retro round, supporting the case for Symmons Plains.

annotations.paragraph: Retro round at Symmons Plains opens up the chance to celebrate a wide range of Tassie race stars, teams and cars and memorable cars and stars from memorable moments in the Apple Isle over the years.
annotations.reason: This paragraph highlights the unique opportunities for celebration at Symmons Plains, supporting the main argument.

annotations.paragraph: The deal between Supercars and the Tasmanian Government was recently extended until the end of 2028.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides new information about the extension of the deal, which is relevant to the discussion of the future of Supercars' retro round.

annotations.paragraph: It’s important this particular round is given an enhanced identity during the contract period.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers an opinion on the importance of enhancing the round's identity, which is relevant to the main premise.

annotations.paragraph: It can only make the decision to renew the deal an easier one when the current deal comes closer to its end point.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a rationale for enhancing the round's identity, which is relevant to the discussion of the contract extension.
